doc.previous: The oldest written manuscripts have been preserved by the perfect dryness of their Middle Eastern resting places whether placed within sarcophagi in Egyptian tombs or reused as mummy wrappings discarded in the middens of Oxyrhynchus or secreted for safe keeping in jars and buried Nag Hammadi library or stored in dry caves Dead Sea scrolls Manuscripts in Tocharian languages written on palm leaves survived in desert burials in the Tarim Basin of Central Asia Volcanic ash preserved some of the Roman library of the Villa of the Papyri in Herculaneum
